title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to Orlando Brown, March 24, 1868
summary: In this montly report, Jackson relates many of the problems in the black communitites to the lack of education and the "vices engendered by slavery." He also reports on the diverse employment opportunities in his Division, as well as the tense relationship between whites and blacks over the issue of the State Constitution.
